title: Stephen Colbert says police who arrested his employees ‘were just doing their job’
summary:
Talkshow host Stephen Colbert on Monday called the recent arrests of seven staffers near the US Capitol “unpleasant” but said both his employees and the police officers who detained them “were just doing their job”.
“Everyone was very professional,” Colbert added during the monologue of his show Monday, four days after the arrests.
The crew members – including Robert Smigel, who voices Triumph – were detained and given citations accusing them of unlawful entry.
“The Capitol police are much more cautious than they were, say, 18 months ago, and for a very good reason,” Colbert said.
He also added: “The Capitol police were just doing their job, [and] my staff was just doing their job.”
